interface.name: FreeGLUT
interface.summary: FreeGLUT is a free-software/open-source alternative to the OpenGL Utility Toolkit (GLUT) library.
interface.description:
GLUT was originally written by Mark Kilgard to support the sample programs in the second edition OpenGL 'RedBook'. Since then, GLUT has been used in a wide variety of practical applications because it is simple, widely available and highly portable.
GLUT (and hence FreeGLUT) takes care of all the system-specific chores required for creating windows, initializing OpenGL contexts, and handling input events, to allow for trully portable OpenGL programs.
